page.title: 17Elderly people's home (1)
page.content: Many elderly people's homes are run by {Avon County Council.}The people who live in these homes are retired, too old to live alone or handicapped in some way. In one home that I know well there are between 54 and 60 people. They are looked after by staff who work shifts, from 0700 hrs. to 1400 hrs. and 1400 hrs. to 2200 hrs. Clerical officers, cooks, care assistants and domestic workers are employed. In charge of the home is a Matron who is also a nurse. Residents have their own rooms. They are called around 0700 hrs. and many have to be dressed by the staff. Breakfast is at 0830 hrs. with a different menu each day. After breakfast residents make their way to the lounge. Some might have their hair washed on Tuesday or Thursday and most bath each day.A helper shaves the men.
